articles.author: ZIMO ZHONG
articles.title: Japan's stocks slump after prime minister election; Shanghai benchmark soars more than 7% - The Associated Press
articles.description: Global markets have had a wild start to the week, with Tokyo's Nikkei 225 index tumbling nearly 5% while Chinese markets soared on news of fresh stimulus for the faltering economy. European markets opened lower. The Japanese yen rose against the U.S. dollar a…
articles.content: HONG KONG (AP) Global markets had a wild start to the week, with Tokyos Nikkei 225 index tumbling nearly 5% while Chinese markets soared on news of fresh stimulus for the faltering economy, with Shan… [+4140 chars]
